intro: Tropaeolum tricolor var. schultzii, commonly known as the scarlet runner bean, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red, orange, and yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters. The plant produces edible pods that are typically harvested when young and tender. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun. Its botanical name reflects its historical classification within the Tropaeolum genus, which includes various ornamental and edible species.
